page.title: 06THE AMBLECOTE AREA, CHANGES
page.content: {Amblecote}grew from a scattering of hamlets into a small industrial township during the 19th century, this being the result of the industrial revolution and the expansion and development of its coal and clay mining, its glass refactories and iron work industries. The present day{Peter's Hill}school is sited on the ground once occupied by the{John Hall Works,}well known for the production of first class fire bricks. From time to time they also opened up pits which produced some very good coal seams and good quality house coal. Today all of this has gone, to be replaced by large modern, private housing estates, altering the character of the area considerably. {PETER'S HILL PRIMARY. }
